The Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF), a South African political party, launched its election manifesto on 2 February 2019 in the country's Gauteng province. The national election is scheduled for 8 May 2019.The party claims that "landlessness and joblessness among black South Africans are at crisis levels, posing the biggest challenges that confront South African society today".This report fact-checks five claims about land occupation, school dropout rates, unemployment, land redistribution and gender balance.
”80% of the population continues to occupy less than 10% of South Africa’s land”
”South Africa has one of the highest school dropout rates”
”Close to 40% of South Africans who need jobs are unemployed, meaning that more than nine million South Africans who need jobs and are capable of working cannot find employment.”
”The post-1994 governments have cumulatively bought less than 7% of the targeted 30% of land meant for redistribution over a period of 25 years.”
The EFF…  “has a higher gender balance in parliament.”
